item.title: A ray of hope breaking through RFK Jr.’s anti-vaccine campaign
item.description: The American Academy of Pediatrics issuing its own vaccine guidance is not just symbolic.

item.title: On gas prices, Californians are getting hosed
item.description: California and the West Coast are like a whole other country when it comes to fuel costs.

item.title: What cost Bill Belichick a chance at the Hall of Fame
item.description: The legendary coach’s six Super Bowl rings somehow weren’t enough for Canton.

item.title: How millions of everyday investors are getting a tax break
item.description: A watershed change by the SEC offers American savers a way to dodge the mutual fund surprise.

item.title: This Super Bowl might get chaotic, thanks to one man
item.description: The big game has never seen someone quite like Seahawks quarterback Sam Darnold.

item.title: Moderna’s chilling announcement is a symptom of a deeper sickness
item.description: China is on track to become the world’s pharmaceutical leader if the U.S. keeps blowing its edge.

item.title: Trump’s IRS lawsuit short-circuits the executive branch
item.description: The leak of his tax records was a crime. For the president to dictate his own payout is absurd.

item.title: Asian countries hedge against China — and America
item.description: Unpredictable superpowers lead smaller countries to lean on each other for economic growth.

item.title: Broken
item.description: Michael Ramirez cartoon on Congress and the slow-moving budget process.

item.title: Free the market from tariffs
item.description: Tariffs, climate change and student loan plans, in readers’ eyes.

item.title: The Democratic win in Texas was shocking, except for this
item.description: The midterm implications for Republicans could be less dire than they appear.

item.title: College deans aren’t protected by academic freedom
item.description: Managerial authority places limits on speech out of necessity.

item.title: Trump can still do more to address affordability
item.description: Tax cuts and deregulation will fuel growth and help lower home prices.

item.title: The White House can’t make babies great again
item.description: Governments can’t increase birth rates. Instead, learn to cope with a shrinking population.

item.title: America is alienating what could become a superpower
item.description: If the “mighty middle powers” coordinate, they can reshape the global balance.

item.title: Washington state’s self-inflicted fiscal crisis is a warning
item.description: Tax and spending increases are driving businesses out of state.

item.title: Charging an EV? Prepare for frustration.
item.description: Public charging stations have advanced considerably, but reliability remains elusive.

item.title: Little to gain by raising taxes on the rich
item.description: New research shows the current top federal income tax rate is close to revenue-maximizing.

item.title: Mayor Mamdani, fiscal hawk?
item.description: There’s reason for skepticism.

item.title: Scheduling new elections for Venezuela
item.description: Trump has leverage to press Delcy Rodriguez to announce a date.

item.title: Jimmy Carter’s pastor: Let’s rebuild the nation’s locker room
item.description: Jimmy Carter’s pastor and other Post readers on political unrest, Minnesota and abortion policy.
